text: Sorry, should have been a little clearer, by old files I mean they're part of the older core CTA functionality, it's the same file loaded with every CTA on every website, i.e. we wrote this file a while ago when the current version of CTA rendering was written so it wasn't part of the more modern set of JS that's deployed on customer sites.
What's your favorite tool / way to add an event calendar to HubSpot CMS? (besides google calendar)

<@U9X4A0X9B> If I’m building an actual calendar display then I prefer <https://fullcalendar.io/>

If it’s going to just be an event listing I usually roll my own.
Thanks, those are both great options!
<@U26BLKGE4> the only reason why i use hubl is because i needed a conditional. is there a way to put a conditional in the design manager? or is that custom module again?
Usually the suggestion would be to use a module, yes. There are a couple other ways to do it, but that would be the most clean.
thanks. appreciate the advice!
no problem!
Has anyone had an issue on Firefox where any <a> links are not clickable? <http://atl10n-4148556.hs-sites.com/>
The <a> must be wrapped around the <button> for Firefox
FF needs you to wrap the button in the <a>
not the other way around
And the form submit looks like it’s being blocked by div.circle-top
a quick fix might be to add ```pointer-events:none;``` to that div

<https://www.creditcanada.com/hs-fs/hub/2686942/hub_generated/template_assets/1528301320512/Custom/page/bz-cc/bz-app.js>

Is there a way to mass update old modules in the DMv2? We just installed a theme for a client and all the CM's in the theme need updating so rather than do one by one, I was hoping there was a "Mass update"

How can I select an "input text" from the HubSpot form with jquery? 

$ ("input [type = 'text']") 
not workinng
I’m not sure that you can have spaces around the equals sign
Or a space between $ and the argument
```$("input[type='text']") ```
that's not the problem, I have to delegate the body to be able to select some element of the form
Do you know if there is an oncomplete of the form?
You can do that if you are embedding the form as code.
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/forms/advanced_form_options>
thank you :smile:

seems like there's been a lot of trouble this whole week past 5pm (eastern). least my sanity is restored that it's something server side and not code just not working.

Quick status update on it, worked with my team to confirm the reason why the loader-v2.js file isn't minified, it's down to how it's generated. That file isn't actually a static file hosted on a CDN, it's dynamically generated for every unique visitor for each individual CTA to build in the right versions or a/b variation for them (i.e. if you and I visit the same page with the same CTA on it, we'll both be served a different loader-v2.js file with our unique version of the CTA in it. For this reason, it's not minified because it'd be an extra step we'd need to take before serving the loader-v2.js file on every request, and since the file is gzipped before being transmitted it should be pretty small to begin with. Out of interest, is it the case that it's something a service like Pagespeed Insights highlighted or was it just something you came across?
I was just thinking that... Whenever I tried to work after 5pm est this past week it seemed to be very sluggish and slow - I was thinking it might be my ISP.
I'm having some really ridiculously bad caching or something in one of my portals
Yep, sounds like it’s time to call it a day then

looks like I can edit stuff again, but flex columns I have are showing their modules in completely disorganized order - the hero is 7th instead of 1st for example. updating content within the modules themselves doesn’t break the display order either
